0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono:
• Keratitis, Vernal: 1 to 2 drops 4 times/day in affected eye(s) for up to 3 months
  • Vernal conjunctivitis: 1 to 2 drops 4 times/day in affected eye(s) for up to 3 months
  • Vernal keratoconjunctivitis: 1 to 2 drops 4 times/day in affected eye(s) for up to 3 months

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono:
• Keratitis, Vernal: age 2 yr and older, 1 to 2 drops 4 times/day in affected eye(s) for up to 3 months
  • Vernal conjunctivitis: age 2 yr and older, 1 to 2 drops 4 times/day in affected eye(s) for up to 3 months
  • Vernal keratoconjunctivitis: age 2 yr and older, 1 to 2 drops 4 times/day in affected eye(s) for up to 3 months

3.title: Breast Feeding
3.mono: Lodoxamide: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Neurologic:Headache
  • Ophthalmic:Blurred vision, Burning sensation in eye, Dry eye, Itching of eye
  • Other:Burning sensation

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Lodoxamide tromethamine is a mast cell stabilizer that inhibits Type I immediate hypersensitivity reactions. Its definite mode of action is unknown, but it prevents the increase in cutaneous vascular permeability of calcium in relation with the reagin or IgE and antigen-mediated reactions.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Ophthalmic
do not wear soft contact lenses while under treatment

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Patient should not wear soft contact lenses during treatment.
  • This drug may cause headache, blurred vision, dry eye, or an itching/burning sensation in eye.
  • Instruct patient on proper instillation technique.
  • Patient should avoid concurrent use of other ophthalmic medications, unless approved by healthcare professional.
